text: Good morning!

Since we're hanging out in Germany these days
we thought we would show you what a German
breakfast looks like.

We've setup the table and as you can see it
consists of a lot of different breads - like
we have a few buns here - and also meats.

Germans like to have salami, ham and just
different deli cuts for breakfast.

We also have a few different cheeses, smoked
salmon and - of course- you can't forget Muesli.

It has been a very nice change in diet since
we left Asia.
Yeah, I'd say.
It is quite the feast I must say as well.

This is a completely different type of meal
from what we were having in Asia.

Most of the time in Asia we would have meals
and breakfasts consisting of rice, noodle
dishes and sometimes dim sum.
This is a much heartier type of meal.

One of the big changes since leaving Asia
is that we're actually eating all of our breakfasts
at home at the kitchen table.

Whereas in Asia we were often going to a little
market or like little street stalls where
they prepare the food in front of us.

In a way it is kind of nice just rolling out
of bed in your pajamas and being able to eat
at home without having to get dressed.
With your bed hair and everything.
Anyways, enough talking.
It is
time to dig in.
Yes.
That concludes breakfast.

We certainly took care of things and now we
just have empty plates in front of us.
And a whole lot of dish washing to do.
